intro: Uleodendron amarum, commonly known as the bitter-leaved tree, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant is known for its bitter-tasting leaves, which have been used traditionally in some regions for medicinal purposes. It typically grows in woodland areas and is adapted to dry, sandy soils. Uleodendron amarum plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
